metadata.title: CVE-2019-10876 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in OpenStack Neutron 11.x before 11.0.7, 12.xbefore 12.0.6, and 13.x before 13.0.3. By creating two security groups withseparate/overlapping port ranges, an authenticated user may prevent Neutronfrom being able to configure networks on any compute nodes where thosesecurity groups are present, because of an Open vSwitch (OVS) firewallKeyError. All Neutron deployments utilizing neutron-openvswitch-agent areaffected.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-10876` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

neutron-common - 2:12.0.5-0ubuntu3
neutron-dhcp-agent - 2:12.0.5-0ubuntu3
neutron-l3-agent - 2:12.0.5-0ubuntu3
neutron-linuxbridge-agent - 2:12.0.5-0ubuntu3
neutron-macvtap-agent - 2:12.0.5-0ubuntu3
neutron-metadata-agent - 2:12.0.5-0ubuntu3
neutron-metering-agent - 2:12.0.5-0ubuntu3
neutron-openvswitch-agent - 2:12.0.5-0ubuntu3
neutron-plugin-linuxbridge-agent - 2:12.0.5-0ubuntu3
neutron-plugin-ml2 - 2:12.0.5-0ubuntu3
neutron-plugin-openvswitch-agent - 2:12.0.5-0ubuntu3
neutron-plugin-sriov-agent - 2:12.0.5-0ubuntu3
neutron-server - 2:12.0.5-0ubuntu3
neutron-sriov-agent - 2:12.0.5-0ubuntu3
python-neutron - 2:12.0.5-0ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: neutron package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:12.0.5-0ubuntu3').
